metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20184 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20181209 Q8, there is a heap-based buffer overflow in the WriteTGAImage function of tga.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted image file, because the number of rows or columns can exceed the pixel-dimension restrictions of the TGA specification.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8').
